meanings.sent1: She redenied his request for a raise.
meanings.sent2: He redenied the accusations made against him.
meanings.sent3: The cat redenied the same treat twice, thinking it was a new one each time.
meanings.sent4: The storm redenied any chance of a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The teacher redenied the student's excuse for being late, knowing it was the same one as last time.

meanings.definition: To refuse to acknowledge or accept something for a second time.
meanings.sent1: They redenied the offer to join their team.
meanings.sent2: She redenied the apology, still feeling hurt.
meanings.sent3: The child redenied eating the last cookie, despite the crumbs on their face.
meanings.sent4: The company redenied the refund request, citing their strict policy.
meanings.sent5: The detective redenied the suspect's alibi, finding inconsistencies in their story.
